item.title: Microsoft apologizes for removing VSCode extensions used by millions
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has reinstated the 'Material Theme - Free' and 'Material Theme Icons - Free' extensions on the Visual Studio Marketplace after finding that the obfuscated code they contained wasn't actually malicious. [...]

item.title: New SuperBlack ransomware exploits Fortinet auth bypass flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new ransomware operator named 'Mora_001' is exploiting two Fortinet vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access to firewall appliances and deploy a custom ransomware strain dubbed SuperBlack. [...]

item.title: Windows Notepad to get AI text summarization in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is now testing an AI-powered text summarization feature in Notepad and a Snipping Tool "Draw & Hold" feature that helps draw perfect shapes. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says button to restore classic Outlook is broken
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is investigating a known issue that causes the new Outlook email client to crash when users click the "Go to classic Outlook" button, which should help them switch back to the classic Outlook. [...]

item.title: Juniper patches bug that let Chinese cyberspies backdoor routers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Juniper Networks has released emergency security updates to patch a Junos OS vulnerability exploited by Chinese hackers to backdoor routers for stealthy access. [...]

item.title: GitLab patches critical authentication bypass vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: GitLab released security updates for Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE), fixing nine vulnerabilities, among which two critical severity ruby-saml library authentication bypass flaws. [...]

item.title: ClickFix attack delivers infostealers, RATs in fake Booking.com emails
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft is warning that an ongoing phishing campaign impersonating Booking.com is using ClickFix social engineering attacks to infect hospitality workers with various malware, including infostealers and RATs. [...]

item.title: Red Report 2025: Unmasking a 3X Spike in Credential Theft and Debunking the AI Hype
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Picus Security
item.description: Credential theft surged 3× in a year—but AI-powered malware? More hype than reality. The Red Report 2025 by Picus Labs reveals attackers still rely on proven tactics like stealth & automation to execute the "perfect heist." [...]

item.title: Facebook discloses FreeType 2 flaw exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Facebook is warning that a FreeType vulnerability in all versions up to 2.13 can lead to arbitrary code execution, with reports that the flaw has been exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: CISA: Medusa ransomware hit over 300 critical infrastructure orgs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA says the Medusa ransomware operation has impacted over 300 organizations in critical infrastructure sectors in the United States until last month. [...]

item.title: New North Korean Android spyware slips onto Google Play
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android spyware named 'KoSpy' is linked to North Korean threat actors who have infiltrated Google Play and third-party app store APKPure through at least five malicious apps. [...]

item.title: Garantex crypto exchange admin arrested while on vacation
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Indian authorities arrested Aleksej Besciokov, the co-founder and one of the administrators of the Russian Garantex crypto-exchange while vacationing with his family in Varkala, India. [...]
